tasks: Create a simple wireframe of a product page using the 8-point grid system, focusing on layout and visual hierarchy (Product Thinking & Strategy: 4/100)
Write down 3 usability heuristics from the NNGroup article and explain how they apply to your current design work (UX Fundamentals: 7/100)
Design a basic error state for a login form using Tesler's Law as a guide (UI Craft & Visual Design: 11/100)
Conduct a user interview and document 5 pain points related to your current design work, using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework (User Research & Validation: 12/100)
Create a mind map of your current design process, highlighting areas for improvement in Product Thinking & Strategy (Product Thinking & Strategy: 4/100)
Redesign a simple UI component (e.g., a button) using the Aesthetic-Usability Effect as a guide (UI Craft & Visual Design: 11/100)
Create a basic user journey map for your current design work, highlighting pain points and areas for improvement in Collaboration & Communication (Collaboration & Communication: 6/100)
Write down 5 principles of Hick's Law and explain how they apply to your current design work (UX Fundamentals: 7/100)
Design a basic prototype of a new feature using the Laws of UX as a guide (Product Thinking & Strategy: 4/100)
Conduct a usability test on your current design work and document 3 areas for improvement in Collaboration & Communication (Collaboration & Communication: 6/100)
Create a comprehensive design system document, outlining principles and guidelines for UI Craft & Visual Design (UI Craft & Visual Design: 11/100)
Develop a basic product strategy document, outlining goals and objectives for your current design work (Product Thinking & Strategy: 4/100)

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the power to shape the user experience and drive business growth through your research-driven design decisions. By focusing on collaboration, communication, and a solid understanding of product thinking and strategy, you can elevate your skills from 7/100 to 8/10 in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, and Product Thinking & Strategy, respectively.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick's Law and its Application in UX Design
topics.summary: Applying Hick's Law to design intuitive navigation and minimize cognitive load for users.
practice_points: Create a wireframe of a website with 5-7 main navigation options, applying Hick's Law principles to reduce cognitive load. Document the decision-making process behind each option.

topics.name: Conducting User Research using the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: Using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to uncover user motivations and needs, informing design decisions that meet those needs.
practice_points: Conduct 2-3 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework, documenting key findings and insights. Create a mind map or diagram illustrating the users' motivations and pain points.

topics.name: Applying Aesthetic-Usability Effect in Visual Design
topics.summary: Using color, typography, and spacing to create an aesthetically pleasing and usable interface that guides user behavior.
practice_points: Design 3-4 different color palettes for a hypothetical product, applying the Aesthetic-Usability Effect principles. Create a style guide document outlining the chosen colors, typography, and spacing tokens.

insights.brief: Current UX skills are below par, indicating a need for improvement in understanding user needs and behaviors.
insights.detailed: The current score of 7/100 indicates that the designer lacks a solid foundation in UX fundamentals, including user research, wireframing, and usability testing. This can lead to designs that are not user-centered and may not meet Explorer's expectations.
actionable: Take online courses or attend workshops to improve understanding of UX principles and best practices
Join online communities or forums to stay updated with the latest trends and design tools
Conduct self-assessments to identify areas for improvement and create a plan to address them

insights.brief: Current UI skills are mediocre, requiring enhancement in visual design and user interface creation.
insights.detailed: The score of 11/100 suggests that the designer has some experience with UI craft and visual design but needs to refine their skills in creating visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces. This can be achieved by experimenting with different design tools and techniques.
actionable: Experiment with various design tools, such as Sketch or Figma, to improve proficiency in digital design
Study the work of other designers and analyze what makes their designs successful
Create a portfolio that showcases your best UI work to demonstrate skills to potential employers

insights.brief: Current user research skills are above average, but there is room for improvement in validating design decisions.
insights.detailed: The score of 12/100 indicates that the designer has a good understanding of user research methods and can conduct effective user interviews. However, they may need to work on validating their design decisions through usability testing or A/B testing.
actionable: Take part in user research workshops or courses to improve skills in conducting user interviews
Practice using usability testing tools, such as TryMyUI or UserTesting, to validate design decisions
Join a design community that focuses on user research and validation to learn from others

insights.brief: Current product thinking skills are lacking, requiring significant improvement in understanding business goals and market trends.
insights.detailed: The score of 4/100 suggests that the designer has limited experience with product thinking and strategy. They may need to work on understanding how products meet user needs and how to create products that align with business objectives.
actionable: Take online courses or attend workshops focused on product thinking and strategy
Read books or articles on product development and market trends to improve knowledge
Join a design community that focuses on product thinking and strategy to learn from others

insights.brief: Current collaboration skills are average, requiring improvement in effective communication with team members.
insights.detailed: The score of 6/100 indicates that the designer has some experience with collaboration and communication but needs to work on building stronger relationships with team members. This can be achieved by practicing active listening and clear communication.
actionable: Practice active listening skills through role-playing exercises or workshops
Join a design community that focuses on collaboration and communication to learn from others
Create a shared document or project management tool to improve transparency and organization
